lines.content: * An abstract class that encompasses possible exceptions in Duke
public abstract class DukeException extends Exception {
* This class is an exception for Duke being unable to read any previous task list
* Creates an exception of Duke being unable to read the previous task list
* @param fileString file path of previous task list txt file
super("WHAT?! its ur first time?! WELCOME WELCOME!\n\n"
+ "If this is a mistake, check your local read/write settings for \n        "
* This class is an exception for Duke finding insufficient arguments for task creation
* Creates an exception to throw if insufficient arguments (separated by '/') are supplied
* @param taskString type of task as a string ("todo", "deadline", "event")
super("Insufficient arguments supplied for " + taskString + "!\n" + taskString
? "a name, a start date and an end date"
* This class is an exception for Duke receiving an invalid date format
* Creates an exception of Duke receiving an invalid date format
* @param s user input string of date
super("Invalid date-time format! Please input " + s + " in the format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm");
* This class is an exception for Duke attempting to import a previous task list from
* a file that does not follow Duke's standards
* Creates an exception to let users know that Duke is unable to load the previous task list
* due to errors within the file
super("OH NO! There was some issue with the previous list! \nDuke was unable to load it... :(");
* This class is an exception thrown for missing task name
* Creates an exception of Duke receiving a command to
* add a task without a task name
super("OOPS!!! The description of a " + string + " task cannot be empty!");
* This class is an exception for Duke receiving a command that is not within
* Creates an exception of Duke not understanding a specified command
super("OH NO!! I DONT KNOW WHAT " + s.toUpperCase() + " MEANS!!");
